snippet: The dash to put new gun controls in place made New York the first flash point in the battles over firearm restrictions that are expected to consume several state capitals this year.
abstract: New York State is nearing agreement on proposal to put some of nation's strictest gun-control laws into effect, including what Gov Andrew M Cuomo vows would be an ironclad ban on assault weapons and large-capacity magazines; Cuomo also endorses new measures to keep guns out of the hands of criminals and the mentally ill in wake of the recent mass shootings in Newtown, Conn.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HALBFINGER and THOMAS KAPLAN
byline.contributor: Michael Cooper and Michael D. Shear contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The dash to put new gun controls in place made New York the first flash point in the battles over firearm restrictions that are expected to consume several state capitals this year.

headline.seo: New York Nears Gun Control Tightening Laws
headline.main: New York Is Moving Quickly to Enact Tough Curbs on Guns
headline.print_headline: New York Nears Law Tightening Limits on Guns
